events.name: RubySG Meetup (Jul 2018 - Matz edition)
events.description: Hi fellow Rubyists! Come join us for our July Ruby meetup at Rakuten Viki and meet Matz, the creator of Ruby! Please register directly at this link (https://ti.to/rubysg/rubysg-jul18-meetup-with-matz). ~~ Meetup Programme ~~ 6:00 PM: Doors open. 6:30 PM: "Ruby after 25 years" by Yukihiro Matsumoto (Matz), creator of Ruby. 7:00 PM: Q&A with Matz. 7:15 PM: Break & group photo-taking with Matz. 7:25 PM: "Keeping sane in a large Ruby codebase", by Duong Nguyen a.k.a Donovan, from Viki. 7:50 PM: Events / Hiring Announcements. 8:00PM: Networking and mingling. 8:30 PM: Event Ends. -------------- - Organizing a Ruby event or launching a product? Tried a new Ruby gem or framework? Tell us about it! - Is your company looking to hire Ruby developers? Please share with us (https://github.com/rubysg/rubysg-reboot) -------------- Thank to our sponsors and supporters! Venue & Food Sponsor: Rakuten Viki Video Recording: Engineers.SG (https://twitter.com/engineersftw) -------------- RubySG Organisers (organisers@ruby.sg)
events.location: Rakuten Viki, 138 Market Street, CapitaGreen 29th storey, Singapore 048946

events.name: Book Club: Challenges for Game Designers
events.description: Book club returns by popular demand ;) After the previous hardcore machine learning course, we are going to switch gears to read about game design: Challenges for Game Designers, by Brenda Brathwaite. You can get the book from Amazon: https://www.amazon.com/Challenges-Game-Designers-Brenda-Brathwaite/dp/158450580X/ We are meeting weekly, covering 2 topics (about 20-40 pages) per week. Same format as previous book club meetups: - Doors open 7pm. Meetup starts 7:30pm and usually runs to 9:00/9:30pm.- Bring dinner/snacks and/or eat beforehand.- Everyone who participates is expected to read the week's chapters beforehand.- We go around the room and everybody talks about one thing you find interesting and/or ask a question regarding the chapters read. Below is a list of all the topics we plan to cover: Week 1:The BasicsGame Design Atoms Week 2:Puzzle DesignConverting Digital to Physical Week 3:Elements of ChanceElements of "Strategic" Skill Week 4:Elements of "Twitch" SkillChance and Skill: Finding the Balance Week 5:Targeting a MarketLearning an Unfamiliar Genre Week 6:Designing a Game to Tell a StoryAdding and Subtracting Mechanics Week 7:"But Make It Multiplayer"Creating a User Interface Week 8:Games as ArtGames as a Teaching Tool Week 9Serious GamesCasual GamesSocial Networks and Games
events.location: Tim and Wei's Residence, #06-160, 9 Boon Keng Road, Singapore

events.name: Carbon Data - Deep Dive
events.description: Come to know more about Carbon data (https://carbondata.apache.org/) and how we are using it for real use cases. Chandra Saripaka will tell everything you need to know about Carbon to have it on your projects.

events.name: ICS Security Online Meetup 7: Control System Security Workforce Challenges
events.description: In our 7th ICS Security Online Meetup of 2018, our discussion leaders will dig into control system Cyber-security Workforce development challenges (Demographics, diversity, limited educational resources, limited company training budgets.) We will profile some of the key work force positions from entry level to leadership. We will also discuss the tensions that exist in many organizations between traditional IT teams and the teams that run the operational technology. This session will answer questions such as:1) How do I change my culture to a cyber security culture in these environments?2) How do I get teams to work together?3) How do I find the right people or do I train people I already have? https://cs2ai.org/meetup-discussions/the-control-systems-security-workforce-challenges/ (ALL VIRTUAL MEETUP SESSIONS ARE AVAILABLE LIVE AND AS RECORDINGS TO PAID CS2AI GLOBAL MEMBERS) DISCUSSION LEADER: SAMARA MOORESamara Moore is the Director of IT Cybersecurity Strategy and Governance at Exelon Corporation where she focuses on partnering across the enterprise to manage cyber and physical security and compliance risks. She brings more than 20 years of IT and Security experience to implementing and sustaining programs to effectively manage cyber risks. Samara is a recognized cybersecurity and critical infrastructure protection expert who specializes in aligning business & technology to manage cyber risk and optimizing processes and tools to enable the business and protect information resources and sensitive data. Moore was previously National Security Staff member at the White House, responsible for the NIST Cybersecurity Framework development. Prior to the White House, Samara co-led the development of the U.S. Department of Energy’s Cybersecurity Capability Maturity Model for power system utilities. DISCUSSION LEADER: REBEKAH MOHRRebekah Mohr is a Security Manager for Accenture, specializing in ICS Security. She provides clients with services such as defining a company-wide ICS Security Program, conducting ICS Security gap assessment or risk modeling workshops, and providing materials and tools to close ICS Security gaps. Rebekah brings experience gained from 6 years working with Shell, where she was responsible for ICS Security at a Refinery, and later joined the global ICS Security Team as a Regional Technical Expert. During her time with the global team, she developed an ICS Security Risk Model, which was the first of its kind in the industry, and she designed a global ICS Security Remediation Program. Rebekah has been awarded with a Young Women in Energy and SANS “People who Made a Difference in Cyber Security” Award. Rebekah is driven to contribute as a thought leader within this space and to make a difference for the next generation of women in the technical workforce. DISCUSSION LEADER: ANDY BOCHMANMr. Bochman provides strategic guidance to senior USG and industry leaders on topics at the intersection of grid and critical infrastructure modernization and security. A frequent speaker, writer and standards developer, Andy has provided analysis on energy sector security actions, standards and gaps to DOE, DOD, DHS, FERC, NERC, NIST, NARUC, the Electricity Subsector Coordinating Council (ESCC), and state utility commissions, most recently testifying before the Senate Energy and Natural Resources Committee on energy infrastructure cybersecurity issues. He previously was Global Energy & Utilities Security Lead at IBM and Senior Adviser at the Chertoff Group in Washington, DC. Andy is currently researching a book on applying engineering fundamentals to critical infrastructure cyber challenges. His recent publications include: “the National Security Case for Simplicity in Energy Infrastructure” (CSIS, 2015), “IoT, Automation, Autonomy and Megacities in 2025: A Dark Preview” (CSIS, 2017), "The Missing Chief Security Officer" (CXO, 2018) and "Internet Insecurity: the Brutal Truth" (HBR, 2018).
events.location: Virtual Meetup - Registration required (see link below), NA, Singapore
events.group_name: Singapore Cyber Security for Controls Systems

events.name: BlockSpace Asia 2018
events.description: **Exclusive invite for Wantedly users** BlockSpace Asia envisions to be Asia’s hub for start-ups and SMEs that are driven by blockchain, artificial intelligence and deep technology. They are a voluntary borderless community of entrepreneurs, services, experts and blockchain enthusiasts. A one-day event connecting over 200 industry leaders, business decision makers, tech innovators and investors, tickets are going fast, so hurry to RSVP now! Link: https://blockspaceasia2018.eventbrite.sg/Complimentary ticket code: BSAWANTEDLY2018 Date: 27 July 2018Time: 10:00 am - 5:00 pmVenue: 3C River Valley Road, The Cannery, Singapore[masked] Programme: 10:00 - Registration10:15 - Opening by Emcee10:20 - Opening Address by Linfinity11:00 - Panel Discussion: Current State of Blockchain Development11:45 - Lunch13:00 - Showcases14:00 - Panel Discussion: How Blockchain Changes the World of Venture Investments15:00 - Panel Discussion: Security Issues of Blockchain15:45 - Panel Discussion: Co-innovation and Internationalisation16:30 - MOU Signing Ceremony16:45 - Fashion Show "Collaboration between Local Fashion Houses" by FESO Asia17:00 - END19:00 - (By invitation only) Roundtable Discussion: The Past, Present and Future of Supply Chain, FMCG and Retail; connecting with Social Commerce and Blockchain22:00 - After party at Zouk (use the stamp on your hand for re-entry) Some of our featured speakers and panellists: Pak Teng Chow, CEO, BlockvitalAnndy Lian, CEO, LinfinityDavy Goh, CEO, BcoinXanne Leo, CEO, InfinitusGrace Tang, CFO, PINCPeggy Heng, CEO, FESO AsiaPeter Sin, Co-founder, Singapore Bitcoin Club / ACCESSBelinda Lim, Founding member, The Good BlockDarren Chua, Co-founder, Fairway ResourcesJames Tan, Managing Partner, Quest VenturesKevin Yang, Co-founder, SharesChainKrissy Teo, Founding member, The Good BlockLeonard, Software Engineer, ConsensysNeo Junhao, Consultant, FortiedgeOng Junhao, Founder, BlockConnectorsPhilipp Kristian, Author, The Trust EconomyTyler Wu Guanli, Managing Director, Huobi Global... and much more! Together with our fellow partners and sponsors:LINFINITYPINCHUOBIBLOCKVITALSINGAPORE BITCOIN CLUBFESO ASIAPRIVILEGEDINSPIREOFORTIEDGEADITUSTHE TRUST ECONOMYACCESSBCOINBLOCKCHAIN AND DAPPS TECHNOLOGYBLOCKCONNECTORSFAIRWAY RESOURCESINFINITUSQUEST VENTURESSHARESCHAINTHE GOOD BLOCKWANTEDLY
